intro: Pavetta stemonogyne, commonly known as the purple pavetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a somewhat rough texture. Pavetta stemonogyne is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and woodland areas.
